person.persName: Benjamin C. Grider (Warren County, Kentucky, resident, attorney, and soldier)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, resident, attorney, and soldier. Bowling Green, Warren County, Kentucky native. Son of Henry Grider and Rachael Grider. Married to Fanny R. Underwood Grider in Warren County on May 31, 1853. Father of Warner Grider, Loving Grider, and Buck Grider. Resident in Warren County in 1850. Attorney in Warren County in 1860. Owned twenty-five enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (USA) as a Colonel from November 26, 1861 to February 7, 1863. Resigned on February 7, 1863.
